{{Use British English|date=July 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2017}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Jay Dasilva |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Jay Rhys Dasilva{{cite web |title=Premier League clubs publish retained lists |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/408901 |publisher=Premier League |date=9 June 2017 |accessdate=22 July 2017}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1998|4|22|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Jay Dasilva |url=https://www.11v11.com/players/jay-dasilva-253784/ |website=11v11.com |publisher=AFS Enterprises |accessdate=22 July 2017}} |birth_place = [[Luton]], England |height = {{convert|1.70|m|order=flip}} |position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] |currentclub = [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]]
(on loan from [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]]) |clubnumber = 3 |youthyears1 = 2007–2012 |youthclubs1 = [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] |youthyears2 = 2012–2016 |youthclubs2 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |years1 = 2016– |clubs1 = [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] |caps1 = 0 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2017 |clubs2 = → [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] (loan) |caps2 = 10 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2017–2018 |clubs3 = → [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] (loan) |caps3 = 38 |goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2018– |clubs4 = → [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] (loan) |caps4 = 18 |goals4 = 0 |nationalyears1 = 2012–2013 |nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] |nationalcaps1 = 4 |nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2013–2015 |nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] |nationalcaps2 = 21 |nationalgoals2 = 1 |nationalyears3 = 2015–2016 |nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] |nationalcaps3 = 4 |nationalgoals3 = 0 |nationalyears4 = 2016–2017 |nationalteam4 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] |nationalcaps4 = 15 |nationalgoals4 = 0 |nationalyears5 = 2017– |nationalteam5 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] |nationalcaps5 = 4 |nationalgoals5 = 0 |nationalyears6 = 2018– |nationalteam6 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] |nationalcaps6 = 7 |nationalgoals6 = 0 |club-update = 17:54, 2 March 2019 (UTC) |nationalteam-update = 18:28, 16 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Jay Rhys Dasilva''' (born 22 April 1998) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for {{English football updater|BristolC}} club [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]], on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] from {{English football updater|Chelsea}} club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], and the [[England national under-21 football team|England national under-21 team]]. ==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Dasilva joined Chelsea from [[Luton Town F.C.|Luton Town]] in 2012, aged just thirteen, along with his brothers Cole and Rio,{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2088254/Jay-Rio-Cole-Dasilva-Footballing-brothers-aged-just-12-13-signed-Chelsea.html|title=Now that's a hat-trick! The three footballing brothers aged just 12 and 13 signed by Chelsea in deal that could net their club £1m|date=18 January 2012|accessdate=14 January 2017|newspaper=Daily Mail|location=London}} and was quickly integrated into the club's youth setup, making his under-18 debut as an under-15 the following year. The following season, he made 23 appearances for the youth team, including scoring in the [[2013–14 FA Youth Cup]] final first leg against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2615464/Fulham-3-Chelsea-2-Charly-Musondas-late-strike-boosts-Blues-Youth-Cup-final.html|title=Fulham 3 Chelsea 2: Charly Musonda's late strike boosts Blues in Youth Cup final|date=29 April 2014|accessdate=14 January 2017|newspaper=Daily Mail|location=London}} During his second full season with the under-18s, Dasilva won the [[2014–15 FA Youth Cup]], as well as the [[2014–15 UEFA Youth League]], playing all but one game in the UEFA Youth League. He signed his first professional contract in July 2015,{{cite web|url=http://www.squawka.com/news/chelsea-sign-jay-dasilva-to-a-professional-contract/415188|title=Chelsea sign Jay Da Silva to a professional contract|date=10 July 2015|accessdate=14 January 2017|publisher=Squawka}} having forced himself into Chelsea's under-21 side, where he established himself as a key player over the next year. He became one of the only players in history to win three [[FA Youth Cup]]s, alongside teammate [[Jake Clarke-Salter]] and five of the famed [[Busby Babes]], when he was part of the Chelsea side that lifted the [[2015–16 FA Youth Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/teams/on-loan-players/jay-dasilva.html|title=Jay Dasilva|accessdate=14 January 2017|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} He was also a member of the Chelsea side that claimed the [[2015–16 UEFA Youth League]], however he was an unused substitute in the final victory against [[Paris Saint-Germain F.C.|PSG]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefayouthleague/season=2016/matches/round=2000699/match=2019575/index.html|title=Chelsea defeat Paris to retain Youth League title|date=18 April 2016|accessdate=14 January 2017|publisher=UEFA}} ====Charlton Athletic (loan)==== On 30 December 2016, Dasilva was loaned to [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2016/12/charlton-loan-move-for-dasilva.html|title=Charlton loan move for Dasilva|date=30 December 2016|accessdate=14 January 2017|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} He made his debut for ''The Addicks'' on 14 January 2017, coming on as a substitute for [[Lewis Page]] against [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]]. He was brought on in the 28th minute, but was later substituted in the 80th minute of the game.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38539095|title=Charlton Athletic 0–0 Millwall|date=14 January 2017|accessdate=14 January 2017|publisher=BBC Sport}} On 4 April 2017, Dasilva was given his first start for Charlton by manager [[Karl Robinson]], in their 2–0 home defeat against [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]], featuring for the entire 90 minutes.{{Cite news |title=Charlton Athletic 0–2 Milton Keynes Dons |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39312460 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 April 2017 |accessdate=29 April 2017}} On 21 July 2017, Dasilva signed a new contract with Chelsea until 2021 and rejoined Charlton Athletic for a second loan spell.{{cite web|url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2017/07/new-deal-and-loan-for-dasilva.html|title=New deal and loan for Dasilva|date=21 July 2017|accessdate=21 July 2017|publisher=Chelsea F.C.}} On 7 May 2018, Dasilva was voted the 2017–18 Fans Player of the Year.{{cite web|url=https://www.cafc.co.uk/news/view/5af08928d8cc1/jay-dasilva-named-201718-player-of-the-year|title=Jay Dasilva named 2017/18 Player of the Year|date=7 May 2018|accessdate=14 May 2018|publisher=Charlton Athletic F.C.}} ====Bristol City (loan)==== On 9 August 2018, Dasilva joined [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]] on a season long loan from Chelsea.[https://www.bcfc.co.uk/news/city-sign-chelsea-defender-dasilva/ City sign Chelsea defender Dasilva] [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]]. 9 August 2018. Retrieved 9 August 2018. ==International career== Dasilva has represented England at [[England national under-16 football team|under-16]], [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]],{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/england/all-teams/players?p=354511|title=Profile|accessdate=14 January 2017|publisher=The Football Association}} [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]],{{cite web |title=England's matches: The under 19's: 2010–20 |url=http://www.englandfootballonline.com/MatchRsl/MatchRslTmU19pg2.html |website=England Football Online |publisher=Chris Goodwin, Glen Isherwood & Peter Young |date=20 July 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}} [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]]{{cite web |title=England's matches: The under 20's |url=http://www.englandfootballonline.com/MatchRsl/MatchRslTmU20.html |website=England Football Online |publisher=Chris Goodwin, Glen Isherwood & Peter Young |date=28 March 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}} and [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] youth levels.{{cite web |title=England's matches: The under 21's: 2010–20 |url=http://www.englandfootballonline.com/MatchRsl/MatchRslTmU21pg4.html |website=England Football Online |publisher=Chris Goodwin, Glen Isherwood & Peter Young |date=9 June 2018 |accessdate=11 August 2018}} He was called up to the England under-16 team shortly after joining Chelsea's youth ranks for a [[Victory Shield]] game against [[Scotland national under-16 football team|Scotland]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dunstabletoday.co.uk/sport/football/hatters/england-u16-call-for-chelsea-s-former-hatters-starlet-1-4530821 |title=England U16 call for Chelsea's former Hatters starlet |date=28 November 2012 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |publisher=Dunstable Today}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/20497968 |title=Phil Neville on the importance of the England youth team |date=28 November 2012 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport |author=Phil McNulty}} He made 4 appearances in total at this age level. He was later called up to the England under-17 team for [[2015 UEFA European Under-17 Championship qualification]] in 2014. He scored his first and only goal at this age group, described as a 'brilliant solo effort', in a 3–1 victory over [[France national under-17 football team|France]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/news/newsid=2174257.html |title=England show champion form with France |date=30 October 2014 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |publisher=UEFA}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2814479/England-U17-3-1-France-U17-Chris-Willock-Patching-Jay-DaSilva-target-Young-Lions-make-three-wins-three.html |title=England U17 3–1 France U17: Chris Willock, Will Patching and Jay DaSilva on target as Young Lions make it three wins from three |date=30 October 2014 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |newspaper=Daily Mail|location=London}} He maintained his place in the squad for [[2015 UEFA European Under-17 Championship|the full tournament]],{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2015/apr/22/england-u17s-squad-named-for-uefa-european-championship-in-bulgaria-220415 |title=John Peacock Names his England Under-17s Group |date=22 April 2015 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |work=The FA}} and played in every game as England were knocked out by eventual semi-finalists [[Russia national under-17 football team|Russia]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under17/season=2015/matches/round=2000665/match=2016633/postmatch/report/index.html#russia+england+reign |title=Tataev strikes as Russia end England reign |date=16 May 2015 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |publisher=UEFA}} His last match for the under-17s came in a 0–0 draw with [[South Korea national under-17 football team|South Korea]] at the [[2015 FIFA U-17 World Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3287392/England-U17-0-0-South-Korea-U17-Young-Lions-fail-seal-automatic-World-Cup-qualification.html |title=England U17 0–0 South Korea U17: Young Lions fail to seal automatic World Cup qualification with stalemate in Chile |date=24 October 2015 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London}} In March 2017, Dasilva was called up to the England under-19 team for [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification]].{{cite web|url=http://www.thefa.com/home/news/2017/mar/16/england-under-19s-squad-160317 |title=Keith Downing Finalises Squad to Play Norway, Spain and Belarus at SGP |date=16 March 2017 |accessdate=5 May 2017 |work=The FA}} In July 2017, Dasilva captained the England under-19 team to victory at the [[2017 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]].{{cite web|title=European Under-19 Championship: England beat Portugal in final|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40619862|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 July 2017|accessdate=22 November 2017}} ==Playing style== After seeing him perform in the 2014–15 UEFA Youth League final against [[FC Shakhtar Donetsk|Shakhtar Donetsk]], former [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] striker and pundit [[Ian Wright]] claimed he was "better than any [current] Premier League left back".{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3038246/Ian-Wright-says-Chelsea-UEFA-Youth-League-winner-Jay-Dasilva-better-Premier-League-left-back.html|title=Chelsea UEFA Youth League winner Jay Dasilva is better than any Premier League left back, insists Arsenal legend Ian Wright|date=14 April 2015|accessdate=14 January 2017|newspaper=Daily Mail|location=London}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|match played 2 March 2019}} {| class=wikitable style=text-align:center |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season
